image.altText: A red children's truck sits in front of some other toys on a floor.

props.synopsis: A Four Corners investigation reveals there are more childcare workers convicted or accused of sexual assault than the public has previously understood, including in the ACT.

title.children: No clear process for revealing abuse allegations at childcare centres

image.altText: A woman smiles looks solemnly into the distance.

props.synopsis: Canberra Liberals leader Leanne Castley has immediately suspended Elizabeth Lee and Peter Cain from the party room, and is seeking to remove them permanently.

title.children: Elizabeth Lee and Peter Cain suspended from Canberra Liberals party room

image.altText: Massage generic showing unidentified woman giving man a massage

props.synopsis: Canberra Institute of Technology has not been offering remedial massage training for more than a year due to a "review". Industry professionals are concerned the delay in reinstating the course will result in not enough therapists to meet demand.

title.children: Massage industry concerned about therapist shortage amid CIT training freeze

image.altText: White power drug, sprinkled on reflective surface, with ziplock plastic bag.

props.synopsis: Advocates say since the ACT decriminalised "personal use" amounts of some illicit drugs, the territory has seen a shift toward meaningful harm reduction, but others are calling for those laws to be repealed, saying they are not working as intended.

title.children: ACT 'beginning to see change' two years on from drug decriminalisation

image.altText: A fish hotel made of wood and rocks in the bend of a slow-moving freshwater river.

props.synopsis: This spring offers a critical window to see if man-made "bungalows" installed in rivers can help a struggling fish species. If they work, they could provide a path forward for restoring other battling Australian freshwater fish populations.

title.children: How ecologists turned fish 'hotels' into 'bungalows' to save a species

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair sits on a couch looking down at an image of a smiling young man with short dark hair.

props.synopsis: After Canberra woman Leesa Mountford's son, Josh Clarke, took his own life at 25, she co-founded grassroots support network I Got You — helping to fill a gap with demand for support services skyrocketing in the past two years.

title.children: After Josh took his life, his mum started a support network in his honour

image.altText: Man wearing sunglasses and a dark blue suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Canberra man Josh Fenwick, 29, is found guilty of raping a 16-year-old girl he took home from Civic with her friend after a night out drinking.

title.children: Canberra man found guilty of raping teen as co-accused's charge dismissed

image.altText: Netball9

props.synopsis: Before they take the court, the Magnolias strap on knee braces and tie bows in their hair. But don't be deceived, they're playing one of the 'most competitive games', and there may be elbows thrown.

title.children: Knee braces are the norm in this competitive sport adaptation

image.altText: 1892 Painting of Julius Caesar, wearing laurel wreath.

props.synopsis: About 140 students have been affected by the Queensland Year 12 external exam blunder.

title.children: Number of schools impacted by year 12 history exam error rises to nine

image.altText: Man looking sad at doorway

props.synopsis: More than 100 residents face an uncertain future after a Queensland council votes to end permanent residencies at a holiday park.

title.children: Dozens of homes now 'worthless' after council's van park decision

image.altText: Illustration of car and home with rooftop solar.

props.synopsis: Plug-in hybrid electric vehicles are sweeping the Australian market. Exclusive modelling suggests the "low-emission" sales boom may actually delay emissions reductions.

title.children: Users say they plug in their hybrid EVs, but the data says otherwise

image.altText: Yasmine Phillips and Chris Robinson with daughters Sage (centre) and Ava.

props.synopsis: A program introduced in Australia in 2018 has led to thousands of fewer babies born early each year, according to a new study.

title.children: These changes mean fewer babies are being born early each year

image.altText: A middle aged white man with white hair looking in the mirror, folding his lips back to reveal broken teeth

props.synopsis: A 12-fold increase in Australians raiding their retirement nest eggs to fund expensive dental treatments in recent years has been labelled a "systemic failure".

title.children: Jon has been left with metal posts instead of teeth and $40k less super

image.altText: White cruise ship on water with island in background.

props.synopsis: The Australian Maritime Safety Authority will speak with the crew of a cruise ship that allegedly left behind an 80-year-old Australian woman, who was later found dead on a Queensland tropical island.

title.children: 'Knew she was dead': Tourists distressed after cruise passenger's body found

image.altText: The Malaysian prime minister sitting in a chair smiling.

props.synopsis: The South-East Asian nation has been in the spotlight this week after hosting the ASEAN summit, which was attended by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and US President Donald Trump.

title.children: 'Things have changed': Malaysia's PM on navigating Trump's tariffs

props.synopsis: After the opposition leader criticised Anthony Albanese for wearing a Joy Division T-shirt, a pair of Nationals say they do not care about the prime minister's attire. Follow live.

title.children: Nats 'don't care' about PM's T-shirt amid Joy Division criticism

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Leaders to wine and dine in Gyeongju
Littleproud calls for review of new BOM site
BOM 'lost confidence' with users in rollout of new website

image.altText: Murray Watt

props.synopsis: Murray Watt warns the Coalition and Greens not to "obstruct" environment laws being introduced to parliament on Thursday, while assuring a special power in the bill would not allow him to intervene on behalf of coal or gas projects.

title.children: Watt fires warning shot at Ley on environment laws

image.altText: grey stacks of a factory in a rural outback setting

props.synopsis: A leading Australian expert in mining safety says the investigation into a fatal explosion at a western New South Wales mine could take a long time because "mining is getting more complex".

title.children: 'Dark days ahead' as experts predict lengthy probe into fatal mine blast

image.altText: Sutherland hospital and Kareena Private Hospital

props.synopsis: A man's death at a Sydney hospital that had its lines to medical gases cut off on Tuesday is now being investigated by police and referred to the state coroner.

title.children: Police investigating man's death after woman's alleged hospital 'sabotage'

image.altText: People gathered around the LEGO City.

props.synopsis: An 80 per cent dropout rate, compliance concerns, and a LEGO city sold as a "highlight" — this multimillion-dollar cybersecurity initiative has been labelled a "patch job".

title.children: 'A show pony': New cybersecurity course had 80pc dropout rate

image.altText: A dejected Matildas player puts her head down as she walks off the pitch with the referee holding up a red card.

props.synopsis: The Matildas were criticised for playing at "walking pace" as two-time European champions England dominate at Derby's Pride Park.

title.children: 'One we want to forget': 10-player Matildas humbled by England

image.altText: A close-up of an Australian Army patch and an Australian flag patch on an ADF officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: The Australian Defence Force will now refer to all sexual or sexual-related offences as "violence" rather than "misconduct".

title.children: Australian Defence Force quietly changes definition of sexual-related offences

image.altText: Tony Burke at press conference

props.synopsis: Human rights groups and politicians say a deal between Nauru and Australia aimed at sending hundreds of former detainees to the Pacific island is "shrouded in secrecy".

title.children: Government blasted over 'secrecy' after first NZYQ deportation to Nauru

image.altText: An orange mesh bag full of oyster shells.

props.synopsis: A marine ecologist's discovery two years ago sparked a restoration project and has become a key element in South Australia's response to a devastating algal bloom.

title.children: The key role a 'lost' reef is playing in SA's algal bloom fight

image.altText: An armed soldier and hospital workers unload bodies at a hospital while a crowd looks on

props.synopsis: More than 60 people have been killed in Rio de Janeiro's deadliest police operation, staged in the lead-up to the city hosting COP30 summit events.

title.children: More than 60 people killed in Rio police operation targeting cartels

image.altText: Krissy Barrett

props.synopsis: In an address to the National Press Club on Wednesday, new AFP Commissioner Krissy Barrett will announce the new taskforce and flag a desire to recast the agency as a national security agency.

title.children: AFP to target men 'hunting' young girls, coercing them to commit violent acts

image.altText: An aerial shot of a small archipelago of islands surrounded by water.

props.synopsis: One the Pacific's most high-profile leaders is pressing Anthony Albanese to fly to the global UN climate summit in Brazil next month to "close the deal" with Türkiye and secure COP31 hosting rights for next year.

title.children: Pacific leader pushing Australia to 'close the deal' on hosting COP31

image.altText: close up sign of Optus

props.synopsis: An inquiry into the telco's triple-0 failure was green-lit by the Senate late on Tuesday and will hold its first hearings in Parliament House next week.

title.children: Optus to be called before senators to explain triple-0 failure

image.altText: A woman in a lab coat and safety glasses extracting a sample from a test tube.

props.synopsis: A study using mice has found high exposure to PFAS lowered the male's sperm count, decreased testosterone and disrupted embryo development.

title.children: High PFAS exposure could impact male fertility, study finds

image.altText: A woman on a sitcom show

props.synopsis: British actress Prunella Scales, best known for playing Sybil Fawlty in beloved sitcom Fawlty Towers, has died age 93.

title.children: Fawlty Towers actress Prunella Scales dies age 93

image.altText: A young golfer completes her swing in an indoor arena.

props.synopsis: Kai Trump receives an invitation to play in a tournament in Florida ahead of starting her collegiate golf career.

title.children: Trump's granddaughter handed entry into LPGA event

image.altText: Man in khaki and wide brim hat stands in front of a group of donkeys

props.synopsis: The State Administrative Tribunal rejects an application to review a DPIRD order to cull more than 100 feral donkeys at a remote Kimberley station.

title.children: Tribunal upholds donkey cull notice at Kachana Station

image.altText: A woman in a country work shirt wih arms folded ina shearing shed background

props.synopsis: Carol Mudford's grassroots charity, sHedway, is dedicated to suicide prevention and positive mental health in the shearing industry.

title.children: Carol Mudford speaks two languages: health and shearing

image.altText: Man in suit and tie

props.synopsis: The Queensland health minister has issued a new directive to ban public doctors from prescribing puberty blockers to youths six hours after a Supreme Court overturned the January freeze.

title.children: Snap new Queensland ban on puberty blockers for transgender adolescents

image.altText: An onshore gas facility, as viewed from across the harbour.

props.synopsis: An oil spill that leaked into Darwin Harbour and the substantial under-reporting of toxic emissions have put one of Australia's biggest gas companies under federal investigation.

title.children: Oil spill, emissions error trigger gas giant federal investigation
